titles: A bryefe and plaine declaracion of certayne sente[n]ces in this litle boke folowing to satisfie the consciences of them that haue iudged me therby to be a fauourer of the Anabaptistes.
Brife and faythfull declaration of the true fayth of Christ
author: I. B., fl. 1547.
Bale, John, 1495-1563, attributed author.
Bradford, John, 1510?-1555, attributed author.
notes: Another edition of STC 1034.7: A brife and faythfull declaration of the true fayth of Christ.
Title pages of other editions read "Per me I.B."; sometimes attributed to John Bale or John Bradford.
Identified as STC 1036 on UMI microfilm reel 21 and STC 14540 on UMI microfilm reel 68.
Reproductions of the originals in the British Library and the Bodleian Library.
Appears at reel 21 (British Library copy) and at reel 68 (Bodleian Library copy).
